author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Regional Director of Reserve Bank of India, A. Sadakkadulla (RBI), on Saturday emphasised the importance of expanding the network of banks for the overall development of the country.

Inaugurating a two-day national seminar on “Financial Inclusion — A New Incarnations in Economic Reforms” at Valluvar College of Science and Management at Karur, he said that although the percentage of people having bank accounts had gone up over the years, a large number of people had not yet opened bank accounts.

The Centre, the RBI, and the public sector banks had been taking a number of steps to bring more people under the banking network. It would ensure that they availed loans and other banking services through proper channels. The financial inclusion was important to achieve higher growth rate. The people should come forward to open bank accounts.

Asking the educational institutions to create the habit of savings among the students, he said it would have a positive impact on their personal life and the overall growth of the country in future.

Sanjeev Singha, General Manager, RBI, Chennai; K.V. Rao, president and COO, Karur Vysya Bank; K. Senguttuvan, Chairman of the College; and Salai Parkunan, Principal of the College, spoke.
title: ‘Financial inclusion essential for achieving growth’
